wikipedia_page.main:
Murray Davies is a Welsh author and journalist.
He was born into a mining family in South Wales. He won a scholarship to UCW Aberystwyth where he studied international politics, followed by an MA in First World War poetry. He worked for the Daily Mail and Mirror Group as a reporter and feature writer. After twenty years as a journalist, he became a novelist. His novel, Collaborator, won the Sidewise Award for Alternate History in 2003. His other works include The Devils Handshake, Dogs on the Street, Samson Option  and The Drumbeat Of Jimmy Sands.
Davies lives in Wiltshire.

response: Collaborator is an alternate history novel by Murray Davies, published as a hardcover on 19 September 2003 and released in paperback in the United Kingdom and the United States in September 2004. The novel is set in a Nazi-occupied Great Britain in 1940 and 1941. It chronicles life during this period primarily through the experiences of Nick Penny, the collaborator of the novel's title.

response: * Collaborator, a novel by Murray Davies, where the Nazis conquered the United Kingdom and the Irish Free State, the Duke of Windsor returns to rule as Regent, whilst Samuel Hoare is the puppet Prime Minister.
